result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michael Terry Chevrier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation today May 3, 2016 by 3:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond to restitution and balance of $4798.60 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF313.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF313.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF313.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested by Agent and follow all recommendations of treatment.

-Defendant to attend Anger Management/Domestic Abuse Assessment within 45 days and follow all recommendations.
-Participate in Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Mr. Bell.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Comply with all terms of Probation and DJOC Agreement.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 16CF167, 15CF412 and 15CF313:
CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer   DF:  Michael Terry Chevrier appeared. Case called at 1:08 p.m. Court notes this is the time for plea and sentencing hearing. SIDE BAR. ADA Correll recites agreement. State files information on 16CF167 and files and amended information on 15CF313. DJOC agreement has also been filed. Restitution in the amount of $5,898.60 is being requested. Victim is present in the courtroom. Atty Wertheimer in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1 & amended Ct. 2 Misd. Battery in 15CF313 . DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping in 16CF167. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF313 and will withhold entry of judgment per the DJOC agreement. DE has a copy of the agreement. Finds DE guilty of Ct. 2 Misd. Battery in 15CF313 and Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping in 16CF167. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses file 15CF412 and Ct's 1, 3 & 4 in 16CF167. DE requesting a restitution hearing on the abililty to pay only. In agreement with the amount being requested. ADA Correll gives sentencing arguments. Victim makes statement. Court recesses at 1:44 p.m. Case recalled at 1:47 p.m. Atty Wertheimer gives sentencing arguments. Court orders:

15CF313 Ct. 2 Misd. Battery:
I/S 2 years probation. 90 days jail. Sign up for probation by 3 p.m. today

16CF167 Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping:
S/W 2 years probation. Concurrent to Ct. 2 in 15CF313

Conditions of Probation on both counts:
-  90 days condition time stayed
-  Must complete if requested psychological evaluation or any other assessment ordered by the probation agent within 30 days
- Restitution in the amount of $5,898.60. Payment plan set through the agent. Bond to apply. 
- Attend Anger Management within 45 days
- Restorative Justice
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment within 30 days
- DNA Sample and 1 DNA Surcharge $200. Pay through probation
- Court costs of $486.00 and supervision fees to be paid through probation
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No abusive contact with Mr. Bell
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. Up to probation agent.
- Comply with terms of probation and DJOC agreement 
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

 Probation review hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

* AMENDED * 

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Billy Bell.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Includes 15CF313 and 16CF167

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Billy B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
